page.title: 13New Arrivals from Hong Kong.
page.content: In 1983 the village of Crynant welcomed into its heart a family that had originally arrived in Britain from Hong Kong. The two daughters in the family, Sonia (Hau Wing Yan) and Belinda (Hau Wing Yin) were both born in the Kwong Wai Hospital in Hong Kong. The children went to school there and lived with their grandmother while their parents travelled to Britain to start a business. At the ages of 6 and 4 respectively, the children and their parents were reunited and moved to Bristol where their father owned a fish and chip shop called 'Sunny's'. Three years later they moved to Crynant and proved to be an asset both to the community, in the form of their fish and chip shop, and to the Creunant Primary School where they have been happy and diligent pupils.
